layer.description: The data is posted to EigenDA which is a separate data availability layer developed by the Eigenlayer team. Only hashes of data are published on an onchain inbox.

bridge.description: There is no bridge that can attest if the data has been made available.

reasonsForBeingOther.label: No proofs
reasonsForBeingOther.shortDescription: The proof system isn't fully functional
reasonsForBeingOther.description: Projects without a proper proof system fully rely on single entities to safely update the state. A malicious proposer can finalize an invalid state, which can cause loss of funds.

reasonsForBeingOther.label: No DA bridge
reasonsForBeingOther.shortDescription: There is no data availability bridge
reasonsForBeingOther.description: Projects without a data availability bridge fully rely on single entities (the sequencer) to honestly rely available data roots on Ethereum. A malicious sequencer can collude with the proposer to finalize an unavailable state, which can cause loss of funds.

display.name: Fuel Ignition
display.description: Fuel Ignition is a high-performance Ethereum L2 built on FuelVM and the Sway language.

badges.name: FuelVM
badges.description: This project uses the Fuel Virtual Machine to run its smart contracts and supports the Sway programming language

badges.name: EigenDA
badges.description: This project is posting its data to EigenDA

stateValidation.description: Currently the system permits invalid state roots. More details in project overview.

dataAvailability.description: Proof construction and state derivation fully rely on data that is posted on EigenDA. The sequencer is publishing data to EigenDA v2. Sequencer transaction data roots are not checked against the DACert Verifier onchain.

exitWindow.description: There is no window for users to exit in case of an unwanted regular upgrade since contracts are instantly upgradable.

sequencerFailure.description: In the event of a sequencer failure, users can force transactions to be included in the project's chain by sending them to L1.

proposerFailure.description: Only the whitelisted proposers can publish state roots on L1, so in the event of failure the withdrawals are frozen.

categories.title: No state validation
categories.description: Ultimately, Fuel will use one round fraud proofs with single round performed via a RISC-V-based zkVM. Currently, there is a 1d challenge period.

risks.text: an invalid state root is submitted to the system by the proposer.

references.title: FuelChainState.sol - Etherscan source code, commit function

dataAvailability.name: Data is posted to EigenDA
dataAvailability.description: No transactions roots are posted onchain and the full data is posted on EigenDA. Since the ServiceManager bridge is not used, availability of the data is not verified against EigenDA operators, meaning that data is not guaranteed to be available.

risks.text: the data is not available on the external provider.

operator.name: The system has a centralized sequencer
operator.description: While forcing transaction is open to anyone the system employs a privileged sequencer that has priority for submitting transaction batches and ordering transactions.

risks.text: the operator exploits their centralized position and frontruns user transactions.

forceTransactions.name: Users can force any transaction
forceTransactions.description: Because the state of the system is based on transactions submitted on the underlying host chain and anyone can submit their transactions there it allows the users to circumvent censorship by interacting with the smart contract on the host chain directly.

references.title: FuelMessagePortalV3.sol - Etherscan source code, sendMessage function

exitMechanisms.name: Regular messaging
exitMechanisms.description: The user initiates L2->L1 messages by submitting a regular transaction on this chain. When the block containing that transaction is settled, the message becomes available for processing on L1. The process of block finalization usually takes several days to complete.

exitMechanisms.name: Forced messaging
exitMechanisms.description: If the user experiences censorship from the operator with regular L2->L1 messaging they can submit their messages directly on L1. The system is then obliged to service this request or halt all messages, including forced withdrawals from L1 and regular messages initiated on L2. Once the force operation is submitted and if the request is serviced, the operation follows the flow of a regular message.

otherConsiderations.name: Fuel operates via the FuelVM and the Sway language
otherConsiderations.description: The FuelVM makes use of the UTXO model and a register-based design to enable parallel transaction processing. The language used is Sway and it does not support Solidity contracts.

actors.name: ERC20Gateway pausers
actors.description: Whitelisted addresses that can pause the ERC20Gateway.

actors.name: FuelMessagePortal pausers
actors.description: Whitelisted addresses that can pause the FuelMessagePortal and blacklist L2->L1 messages.

actors.name: FuelChainState pausers
actors.description: Whitelisted addresses that can pause the FuelChainState.

actors.name: Proposer
actors.description: Permissioned address that can propose new state roots.

actors.name: Fuel Security Council
actors.description:
A Multisig with 9/12 threshold. 
Can upgrade the FuelERC20Gateway, FuelMessagePortal and FuelChainState contracts, potentially gaining access to all funds. It can unpause contracts and remove L2->L1 messages from the blacklist. It can also limit the tokens that can be bridged to L2.

references.title: Security Council members - Fuel Ignition docs

ethereum.name: FuelERC20Gateway
ethereum.description: Standard gateway to deposit and withdraw ERC20 tokens. It implements rate limits and a whitelist for tokens. The whitelist is currently active.

ethereum.name: FuelMessagePortal
ethereum.description: Contract that allows to send and receive arbitrary messages to and from L2. Pausers are allowed to blacklist L2->L1 messages.

ethereum.name: FuelChainState
ethereum.description: Contract that allows state root submissions and settlement.

risks.text: a contract receives a malicious code upgrade. There is no delay on upgrades.
the limit of tokens that can be withdrawn is set too low.

milestones.title: Switch to EigenDA
milestones.description: Data publishing to Ethereum blobs is stopped and moved to EigenDA without a DA bridge instead.

milestones.title: Fuel Ignition Mainnet is Live
milestones.description: Fuel Ignition announces its official launch.
